External_Reference.reference_text: Jaret, S.J., Johnson, J.R., Sims, M., DiFrancesco, N., and Glotch, T.D., Microscopic and petrographic comparison of experimentally shocked albite, andesine, and bytownite, Journal of Geophysical Research, 123, 1701-1722, 2018, doi:10.1029/2018JE005523.

Instrument.name: Center for Planetary Exploration at Stony Brook University WITec Alpha300R Raman Imaging Spectrometer
Instrument.description: The WITec Alpha300R Raman Imaging Spectrometer is located at the Center for Planetary Exploration at Stony Brook University. It features 2 laser excitation sources (532 nm and 785 nm), an advanced confocal microscope, 2 high throughput spectrometers, and software capable of powerful multivariate analysis. It acquires spectra from 3500-100 Î”cm-1 and is equipped with multiple objective lenses, allowing for spatial resolutions between several microns and 350 nm/pixel.
